result.execSummary:
The defendant Lavekeio L. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.
  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

09:07 AM Attorney Jennifer A Lohr appeared by video & audio means by ZOOM for Defendant Lavekeio L. Smith.  Attorney Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared by video & audio by ZOOM means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Defendant Lavekeio L. Smith appeared by phone means from New Lisbon Correctional by ZOOM.  Seeking sentence modification.  Two factor inquiry.  Atty. Lohr makes argument with COVID 19 in jail/prison is a major new factor.  Objective test - wasn't present at sentencing. 2nd if warranted for modification.  State agrees new factor with COVID 19.  Health concerns is a highly relevant in sentencing decision,  for the first step of the analysis.  Atty. Lohr makes argument for 2nd step of modification.  Health issues.  Social distancing, cleanliness and masking.  Not following guidelines.  2 proposals - Ct 1 & 2 confinement portion done, serving Count 4 now. Modify Count 4 to  2 yrs. 10 mos. I.C. concurrent & 5 yrs. E.S. OR under 973.015(8) stay sentence for legal cause until safe to come back.  DE does have housing if released.  Atty. Ryan gives argument and objects to modification DE not entitled to relief as proposed today.  Court states can't take judicial notice, agents haven't been face to face with probationers. Atty. Lohr responds.  Court believes sentence that was imposed is appropriate and denies motion for modification.  Court will deny request for stay.

Henney gives recommendation and to follow what the agent requests.  DE makes statement. Court imposes sentence.
